tree

Class Tree

  • java.lang.Object
    • tree.Tree

  • public class Tree
extends java.lang.Object

    The Tree class represents a binary search tree (BST) structure. It contains a data value, two Tree objects (a left side and a right side), and a unique id value used in searching.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Tree.side
      The side enum is used to determine on which side of a Tree object a subtree is to be referenced.

      • Tree

        public Tree(int id)
        Create a single-node Tree object containing data.
        Parameters:
        data - - The value stored within the Tree.

      • Tree

        public Tree(Tree t)

        Copy-constructor. Used when a complete copy of a tree is needed.

        Parameters:
        t - - The tree to be copied.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public int getId()

        Get the id of a Tree object.

        Returns:
        The id value of the Tree.

      • idSearch

        public Tree idSearch(int id)

        Searches a Tree object for a specific node based on an id value.

        Parameters:
        id - - Identifies the Tree object to be found.
        Returns:
        If the id value is found somewhere in the tree, the corresponding sub-Tree object is returned. Otherwise, returns null.

      • insert

        public boolean insert(Tree chld)
        We expect the tree to be a binary search tree for this to work.
        Parameters:
        chld -
        Returns:
        Success/failure of insertion.

      • remove

        public boolean remove(int id)

        Removes a node with id value matching id from the tree.

        Parameters:
        id - - The id value of the node to be deleted.
